dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels b Mohammad Saifuddin 19 (32b 2x4 0x6) SR: 59.37

dismissalComment.html: bowled off the inside edge short and outside off, it was the off-cutter. Samuels with no movement of feet, just stood in his crease and tried to drive on the up. The ball nips back enough to take the inside edge and crash into the stumps. He's thrown it away after starting slowly and just when he was beginning to look good

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: cuts it straight to point Soft dismissal. It was too short, and he cleared his front leg to try and flay it on the off side, but only ended up thick-edging it. Easy catch for the fielder and West Indies have lost their first

headshotImage.caption: DM Bravo headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DM Bravo headshot

dismissalComment.html: fuller on middle and leg, was tossed up a bit, Bravo looks to break the shackles. Tries to go big down the ground, misses and the ball clatters into the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: given and that looked plumb Mehidy continues his hold over Hetmyer, who's going off without reviewing. Got stuck on the crease, Mehidy uses the angle from around the wicket to get it to dip and skid on, Hetmyer doens't know whether to go forward or back, ends up prodding from the crease with bat beside pad. The ball held its line though and hit pad. Replays show it would have clipped leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken by the keeper nice loop to the ball, changes his linen to outside off. Rovman is dragged forward to defend, but he's playing for turn that isn't there. At best the ball turned only gently, and takes his outside edge. Mushfiqur holds on, standing up to the stumps. Wait a minute, Rovman has reviewed this. Substitute Carlos Brathwaite has come on and is arguing with the umpires. The commentators on air saying it could be something to do with number of fielders inside the circle/outside it. Brathwaite is still in the middle and gesturing, standing alongside Hope and Powell. On the other side of the pitch the Bangladesh players are gathered. It ends in Brathwaite walking off, and Powell is walking back too. So he's definitely out.

dismissalComment.html: the stumps have gone for a walk keeps it full and straight, slower one nipping back in. Keemo went for an almighty swing of the bat, he was looking to hit it over long-off possibly. Ends up losing his stumps without getting a touch on the ball

dismissalComment.html: given lbw and he's reviewed it that was just going on with the angle, strikes him below the knee roll from back of a length, but was it missing leg? Struck him in front of middle and leg. He was trying to flick it off the back foot. No bat involved, as Ultra Edge confirms, and it's clipping leg-stump too. Umpire's call, so Roach has to go. The umpire seemed to almost forget he had given it out

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh have won by eight wickets, with 11.3 overs to spare Fuller ball, wide of off, and he goes for the drive, opening the face once again and beating the man at short third man to get the winning runs. Comprehensive win, and Bangladesh take the series 2-1

commentPostTextItems.html: 7.10pm That's all from us for the ODI series. Shai Hope single-handedly made it competitive, but collectively, Bangladesh were too powerful for West Indies. Can the visiting side change the script in the T20Is? Join us on December 17 to find out. Till then, this is Saurabh Somani, signing off on behalf of Hemant and Thilak.

7.04pm Rovman Powell: "Unfortunate for Oshane to miss out. We wanted an extra spinner today. Hope deserves a lot of credit. Lots of things to rectify, we have to go back to the nets and continue to work hard. We are making improvements, it's just that we are not improving at international pace." He also had words of praise for Shai Hope.

Mehidy Hasan Miraz is the Man of the Match. "I am really happy with bowling first because the wicket was turning a little. Thanks to our team-mates. Mushfiqur told Mashrafe that I should bowl when Hetmyer came in to bat, so thanks to Mushy."

Shai Hope is the Player of the Series. Well deserved. "Still a bit dizzy to be honest, but hanging in there. Yes I got a hundred, but obviously you want to win more than getting these hundreds. (On the lack of support adding pressure) Just a bit. But it's important for me to keep it flowing. One of those days."

Finally, we have winning captain Mashrafe Mortaza speaking to raucous cheers from the crowd. "All three matches bowlers have been good. The spinners especially bowled really tight. Overall it's going alright. I think we'll do well in the T20s too, but West Indies are world champions and a very good side in T20s."

6.50pm Both of Bangladesh's wins were dominant. West Indies avoided the ignominy of a sweep thanks to Shai Hope, but that's the only thing they had going for them. For my money, Hope is the Man of the Match today too, though Mehidy will probably get it for his 4-29. But Hope's was a fantastic against-the-odds innings, going completely solo. The next highest for West Indies was 19, while Hope made 108*. His strike-rate was 82.44 - that too dragged down by falling wickets - and no one else scored at more than 60 even.

commentTextItems.html: cheeky length ball outside off and he just comes forward, opens the face of the bat at the last moment to run it down to third man and tie the scores

commentPreTextItems.html: Malcolm : "Despite his team getting a pasting the one player everyone will remember from this rather forgettable game is Shai Hope. If only there was an award for being an absolute boss in trying circumstances."

commentTextItems.html: full ball outside off, he comes forward and opens the face to steer to point
keeps it a bit fuller outside off, slapped to cover

commentTextItems.html: same ball, same shot, better result. short outside off again, and he stays beside the ball, and cuts it uppishly. Goes all the way
too short and put away. Room outside off and he's not pacy enough to bowl it so short. Mushfiqur rocks back and cuts it over point
fuller on the stumps, and defended back to the bowler
fuller outside off, and Mushfiqur gets feet moving that time, comes forward to drive it well. But straight to cover
full outside off, given some room and he goes on his knees for a flowing cover drive. However, can't get past the fielder in the circle, who parries it
beaten again. In the channel again and Mushfiqur's bat is going like a magnet to the ball in that channel. Feet not moving. He pokes at thin air again

commentTextItems.html: patted back to the bowler

inside edge goes for four well bottom edge technically. This was bowled wide of off, and Mushfiqur went hard at it, again without moving feet. Kept a little low and it takes his under-edge to go to the keeper's left. He got a glove to it, but couldn't stop it
fuller on off stump, driven to extra cover off the front foot
oooh, beaten. In the channel outside off, slightly back of a length. Mushfiqur finds himself reaching for it without moving his feet and is beaten

commentPreTextItems.html: Tahseen: "Tamim really wanted Soumya to score that century. I could hear him say "don't take a run" through the mic."
ferdous06: "it's quite difficult to score 20 runs out of 23. hope Soumo learns this lesson. fantastic innings though. "

commentTextItems.html: back of a length angling into the batsman but ends up on his pads, and his turned this to fine leg

commentTextItems.html: slower ball, off-cutter bowled on off stump. He's equal to it though and pats it back gently to the bowler's right
back of a length outside off, he steers it to third man to get off the mark. The man had to run to his left which allowed them to take two
good length outside off, he defends off the front foot to point

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar b Paul 80 (81b 5x4 5x6) SR: 98.76

commentTextItems.html: leg stump goes for a walk might be too late to affect the match, but it's a victory for the bowler nonetheless. Soumya's impetuousness gets the better of him. He tried to whip a ball across the line that was too full, ends up playing all around it, and it sneaks through bat and pad to take out the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Shimron Hetmyer lbw b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 0 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: given and that looked plumb Mehidy continues his hold over Hetmyer, who's going off without reviewing. Got stuck on the crease, Mehidy uses the angle from around the wicket to get it to dip and skid on, Hetmyer doens't know whether to go forward or back, ends up prodding from the crease with bat beside pad. The ball held its line though and hit pad. Replays show it would have clipped leg stump

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 1 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: taken by the keeper nice loop to the ball, changes his linen to outside off. Rovman is dragged forward to defend, but he's playing for turn that isn't there. At best the ball turned only gently, and takes his outside edge. Mushfiqur holds on, standing up to the stumps. Wait a minute, Rovman has reviewed this. Substitute Carlos Brathwaite has come on and is arguing with the umpires. The commentators on air saying it could be something to do with number of fielders inside the circle/outside it. Brathwaite is still in the middle and gesturing, standing alongside Hope and Powell. On the other side of the pitch the Bangladesh players are gathered. It ends in Brathwaite walking off, and Powell is walking back too. So he's definitely out.

dismissalText.commentary: Kemar Roach lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 3 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: given lbw and he's reviewed it that was just going on with the angle, strikes him below the knee roll from back of a length, but was it missing leg? Struck him in front of middle and leg. He was trying to flick it off the back foot. No bat involved, as Ultra Edge confirms, and it's clipping leg-stump too. Umpire's call, so Roach has to go. The umpire seemed to almost forget he had given it out

dismissalComment.html: leg stump goes for a walk might be too late to affect the match, but it's a victory for the bowler nonetheless. Soumya's impetuousness gets the better of him.
